title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: Activities to be undertaken will aim at helping the Superintendency and the Banco Central de Reserva address in a comprehensive way continued risks in the banking sector, particularly non-credit risks such as market risks and various types of liquidity risks. This involves improving the on and off-site examination functions and integrating the process to provide seamless oversight and improved monitoring of the risks in the banking system, including an Early Warning System (EWS). CAMELS indicators should be revised to more accurately reflect safe and sound standards.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Work with the Ministry of Finance and Banco Central de Reserva, financial regulators and market participants to improve, manage and coordinate debt issuance, reorganization of public finance, manage national liquidity, manage risk, and emphasize liquidity in the domestic bond market and the banking system.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: The Resident Advisor is providing technical assistance to promote increased levels of financial inclusion in the country, and develop the legal and regulatory framework of financial nature tied to the topic. He is also providing TA in designing and supporting the development of a public policy that promotes financial inclusion, designing and executing a strategy that will allow for the implementation of the public policy of financial inclusion. He is helping the counterparts to design, develop and implement a methodology to monitor national financial inclusion levels (to include tracking indicators and measurement tools) and advising on the creation and/or modification of the legal and regulatory framework applicable to the financial institutions that are directly involved in financial inclusion.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Work with the MoF and Banco Central de Reserva, financial regulators and market participants to improve, manage and coordinate debt issuance; reorganization of public finance office; improve market and banking system liquidity; manage liability risk.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - El Salvador

description.narrative: Intermittent advisor is providing technical assistance to the Instituto de Garantia de depositos of El Salvador in updating their legal framework to adapt their deposit insurance scheme and resolution process to the Internationally accepted best practices such as the IADI Core Principles for Effective Deposit Insurance Systems and the Key Attributes of Effective Resolution Frameworks.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services -El Salvador

description.narrative: Intermittent Advisor is providing support to the SSF to develop a new IT Risk Manual to ensure all necessary security protocols are in place. Support is also being provided to develop new supervisory methods for previously unsupervised financial cooperatives in addition to directing the development and implementation of a new website function allowing publication of appropriate financial sector time-series and relative analytical tools. A new regional study of Money Business Services will be initiated in the country with subsequent rollout expected throughout the region

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Build the capacity of relevant governmental institutions to identify, promote, develop, tender and execute infrastructure projects; with the El Salvador International Airport project as the initial IFT activity. Additional assistance provided to the Ministry of Finance for PPP-related risk analysis and improved accounting and reporting of subsidies and contingent liabilities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Provide TA to CEPA on best practices in the areas of operations, administration and project execution. OTA work will focus assistance on improving profitability of its operating units, insuring safety and maximizing the use of CEPAs strategic assets. Of key interest for CEPA is the international airport, for which there are detailed tasks relating to preparing the airport to implement the Master Plan, enhancing profitability, establishing activity based costing and key performance metrics, strengthening risk management and contract compliance management, building a project management team, and, as needed, creating a PPP contract compliance function within CEPA, as well as planning a program office and making sound business decisions on the best way to implement and finance the Master Plan expansion project. Other areas of TA focus include the revitalization of the FENADESAL rail operations; and the better use of underutilized CEPA facilities at La Union, and other places as needed. Other areas of TA are the development of institutional and staff capacity to direct and manage the national PPP program, as well as advise Ministry of Hacienda PPP staff on key knowledge,

description.narrative: Provide TA to CEPA on best practices in the areas of operations, administration and project execution. OTA work will focus assistance on improving profitability of its operating units, insuring safety and maximizing the use of CEPAs strategic assets. Of key interest for CEPA is the international airport, for which there are detailed tasks relating to preparing the airport to implement the Master Plan, enhancing profitability, establishing activity based costing and key performance metrics, strengthening risk management and contract compliance management, building a project management team, and, as needed, creating a PPP contract compliance function within CEPA, as well as planning a program office and making sound business decisions on the best way to implement and finance the Master Plan expansion project. Other areas of TA focus include the revitalization of the FENADESAL rail operations; and the better use of underutilized CEPA facilities at La Union, and other places as needed. Other areas of TA are the development of institutional and staff capacity to direct and manage the national PPP program, as well as advise Ministry of Hacienda PPP staff on key knowledge,

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Work with the MoF and Banco Central de Reserva, financial regulators and market participants to improve, manage and coordinate debt issuance; reorganization of public finance office; improve market and banking system liquidity; manage liability risk.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.
